dt: {bc}having lost one's sense of time, place, or identity

dt.t: She opened her eyes, startled and {wi}disoriented{/wi} for an instant. The little cell she slept in was dismally black.
Since fleeing to London, the 40-year-old businessman has had nightmares, chest pains and is so {wi}disoriented{/wi} that he can barely look after his kids.
He remembered nothing for more than a few seconds. He was continually {wi}disoriented{/wi}.

shortdef: having lost one's sense of time, place, or identity

dt: {bc}to cause to lose bearings {bc}displace from normal position or relationship
{bc}to cause to lose the sense of time, place, or identity

shortdef: to cause to lose bearings : displace from normal position or relationship
to cause to lose the sense of time, place, or identity
